column4: people i installed eclipse in /opt directory, but i want to launch the program without going to the particular directory. I heard i need to set path. when i google it they talk about writing the bin directory inside profile.d file
that the way ?
without going to the particular directory? just use a launcher imo, why would you want to start eclipse from console anyway
not eclipse, any custom installed applications i want to launch by pressing Alt+f2 and hit the command
thank you will have a look now
oh actually, people recommend "Gnome Do" instead of launchy :) may be worth checking out more
launchy not in ubuntu repo nor does gnome-do
they may have deprecated gnome-do in favor of unity (it works similarly, I guess)
these search utilities will eat more hardware resources in the process of indexing ?
but actually gnome do is in my repositories :)
which version of ubuntu you are running ?
probably, but I dont think it will be at all noticable
natty
my bad, even i have it in my repo
I've only ever used gnome do
oh
yeah, gnome-do searches for existing commands
if I remember correctly there are a bunch of plugins you can enable/disable too :)
yeah, amazing. looking at it as we speak
export PATH=${PATH}:/opt/eclipse worked
np :)
